abstract: The case was the first by the National Labor Relations Board to assert that employers break the law by disciplining workers who post criticisms on social-networking sites.
snippet: The case was the first by the National Labor Relations Board to assert that employers break the law by disciplining workers who post criticisms on social-networking sites.
lead_paragraph: An ambulance company that fired an employee after she criticized her supervisor on Facebook agreed on Monday to settle a case brought by the National Labor Relations Board.

headline.main: Company Settles Case in Firing Tied to Facebook
headline.print_headline: Company Settles Case In Firing Tied To Facebook
